title: Trent Alexander-Arnold labels Manchester United a 'top side'
text:
Trent Alexander-Arnold believes Manchester United are still a 'top side' despite their struggles under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer this season.

League leaders Liverpool make the trip to their arch rivals at Old Trafford on Sunday with an eight-point advantage over Manchester City.

United, on the other hand, are just two points clear of the relegation zone after a woeful start to the new campaign.

Trent Alexander-Arnold insists that bitter rivals Manchester United are still a 'top side'

Manchester United have struggled this season and are just two points above relegation zone

But despite the contrasting fortunes of both sides, the English right-back believes it remains one of the standout games of the season.

'Traditionally and historically, the Man United-Liverpool game is always massive,' Alexander-Arnold told Premier League Productions.

'It's one of the biggest games of the season and they're a top side as well.

Liverpool welcomed back Brazil No 1 Alisson to first-team training at Melwood on Tuesday

Mohamed Salah is also fit after going off with an ankle injury in the win over Leicester

'It's always going to be a big game and a big occasion because both teams want to win it so much.'

Jurgen Klopp looks set to welcome back Alisson to his starting lineup after the Brazil No 1 returned to full training at Melwood on Tuesday.

Mohamed Salah also played a part despite suffering an ankle injury in the win over Leicester before the international break.
description: League leaders Liverpool make the trip to their arch rivals at Old Trafford on Sunday with an eight-point advantage over Manchester City.
